Name: Millennial AF
Description:
What is a mile… What is a mimosa… What is a millennial? It’s a pretty common question on Google. The millennial generation has generated more intrigue than any other. And rightly so in our opinion. That’s why we created Millennial AF: the “Who’s most likely to” card game that’ll reveal the biggest bottomless brunching, quinoa munching, Insta-influencing millennial in your group.

Here’s how it might play out…
Jess: “Who’s most likely to… text ‘I’m outside’ rather than ring the doorbell?
Josh: “Well that can’t be me. I’d never do that.”
Sam: “That’s totes something you’d do, Josh!”
Jess: “Josh IMHO.”
George: “Josh. Without a doubt.”
Josh: “WTF?!”

Josh then gets that card. And at the end each player tallies their cards; the one with the most is the most millennial of them all.

Millennial AF is the generational game based on typical millennial traits. You’ll be surprised at just how millennial we all are…

Name: Rune & Write
Description:
Rune & Write is a game with roll and write mechanic with symbol combination and rune casting that lasts between 30-40 minutes and designed for 1 to 4 players based on the universe of Runaljod: The sound of the runes.

Rune & Write is played over 8 rounds in which all players can take turns simultaneously. Each player will try to be as efficient as possible with the runes they have available and their possible combinations.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Druid Master
Description:
Welcome to The Druid Master, a tabletop game that will teach you the healing power of medicinal herbs.
An educational fast paced cards game for 1-4 players.

"You are in the middle of the forest, wrapped in the reassuring embrace of nature, and as a Druid you hold and master the ancient art of healing the various ailments, which affect the human body, with the herbs, plants and trees that surround you.

And so different people will come looking for you who need your help but, beware, you are not alone!

There are also other experienced Druids who compete with you to cure these patients.

You will have to prove that you can treat them better than your rival Druids, so that you will be proclaimed the one and only Druid Master!"

The game consists of 8 rounds where players will have to treat patients with the plants at their disposal.

The plants are represented by cards, which describe the benefits of the plant in percentages.

7 plant cards are drawn at the beginning of the game and 2 at the beginning of each turn.

You can use from 1 to 3 plant cards, in combination, to try to cure the patient as much as possible.

(You can study best combination hidden by the proper player screen)

Each turn an event card is drawn that affects all players (famine, harvest day...).

There are also effect cards: one for each player, to be played in the best moment of the game, to take an advantage on the other players or to hinder them.

Name: Lace Warfare: Tactical Level Combat in the Age of Reason
Description:
Lace Warfare: Tactical Level Combat in the Age of Reason primarily covers the Austrian Succession, Seven Years War, French and Indian War, and American War of Independence, but can also be employed for the War of the Grand Alliance, War of the Spanish Succession, and the Great Northern War.

Lace Warfare uses miniature model soldiers on a table laid out with model terrain, along with dice, rulers, and various markers. 
There is no bookkeeping involved in these rules. All changes in status can be represented on the table by markers, stand positions etc...
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Tic Tac Tics
Description: Tic-tac-toe on 5x5 grid. Three in a row is called a run. Four in a row gets an extra run and five in a row gets extra three runs. When the grid is filled, the difference between the winner and the loser is called the net run. Play then continues to a new sheet. First player to score 11 net runs wins.

Name: The Game of Fuzzy Logic
Description:
The Game of Fuzzy Logic. The game where the best clues are the ones that aren't too good. Are you clever enough to give clarity to your teammates while simultaneously confusing your rivals?

In Fuzzy Logic, two teams take on pairs of mystery words, going head-to-head to see which team can correctly guess its word first. Here’s the twist: Each pair of words is in some way related, so really good clues are ones that help your team while at the same time hindering your opponents!

The first team to win 9 points wins the game.
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: La Valse des Masques
Description:
La Valse des Masques (The waltz of masks)

16th century. You are the head of one of the 4 most respected and powerful noble families in Venice. You must use your power to maintain your family's influence and power in the Great Council. The future Doge must be in your favour!  Use every trick in the book and reach the highest levels to rule the Republic of Venice!
Waltz of the Masks is a card game of actions, placements and combinations.

Objective of the game :
The main objective is to have the most influence points, and therefore usually the most "revealed" cards in the highest position, before the end of the game. The higher a "revealed" card is, the more influence value it has for the final count. Thematically, a high card is an advisor who influences the upper echelons of the city.

Players play cards in rows and push cards from the bottom row to the top. Cards can be played face up to perform card effects or face down to hide these effects until they come into force later in the game. Players cannot play the same card as the previous player, or the same card as the last player of the previous turn if you are the first player of the turn.

—description from publisher


Vous êtes à la tête d’une des 4 familles nobles les plus respectées et puissantes de Venise. Vous devez user de votre pouvoir afin de conserver l’influence et la puissance de votre famille au sein du  Grand Conseil. Le futur Doge doit vous être favorable! 
Usez de toutes les filouteries et atteignez les plus hautes sphères afin de régner en maître sur la République de Venise!
La Valse des Masques est un jeu de cartes d'actions, de placement et de combinaisons.

Objectif du jeu :
L’objectif principal est d’avoir le plus de points d’influence, et donc en général le plus de cartes “révélées” dans la position la plus haute, avant la fin de la partie.
Plus une carte “révélée” est haute, plus elle a de la valeur en influence pour le décompte final. Thématiquement, une carte haute est un conseiller qui influence les hautes sphères de la cité.

Name: Bedlam, the Board Game
Description:
Bedlam is a turn based game that employs versatile tile placement and card management.

Tiles will produce resources (gold and armies) and are the main mechanism for gaining points. Object of the game is to amass 10 points.

There are three categories of cards. Move cards enable you to relocate and gain valuable resources. Action cards are used to hinder or counteract your opponents game play. Instant cards are used at any time to help or hinder opponents and also contain secret points to assist in the objective.

Players are limited to 1 attack phase per turn and this mechanic is a basic 1-1 exchange. There are cards that can be used to eliminate armies without an attack and also to add to defense during an attack.

The game is not played on a set board, but is built by adding tiles during gameplay so each game will be different than the last.

—description from publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Baba Yaga
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Hansel and Gretel
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Jack and the Beanstalk

Name: Slaughterville: Director's Cut
Description:
In Slaughterville Director’s Cut, the Villains, Characters, and Locations have been updated to be more in line with our new faster and deadlier style. It is a reimagining of Slaughterville and it can use all components from either/both of the previous editions of the game.

For example, the Serial Killer will leave clues at each Location, the Slasher will more more on the hunt, and more. Characters will get a facelift and Locations will get a needed boost.

Slaughterville Director's Cut is a 1-6 Player game of fun and horror. You will take on the role of one of our 28 characters, build a modular town, and choose one of our Villains to face off against. Each Villain affects the way that the game plays coming with their own win conditions and rules modifications to make the game thematic and fun!

Can you defeat the Villain?

—description from publisher

Name: Mindfulness Game
Description:
Mindfulness Games for Kids, Therapy Card Games: 3 Games in 1 Box, Fun Family Games That Teach Mindfulness, Social and Emotional Skills, Therapy Tools for Counselors and Teachers

Guess: A pack of cards with questions on each. Each player takes turns guessing how well they know their child/siblings. Every correct answer gets a sticker. The player with the most stickers wins!

Connect: A pack of cards with topics on each. Connect with your family members by answering the questions on a variety of topics. Every correct answer gets a sticker. The player with the most stickers wins!

Experiment: A pack of cards with a set of tasks and experiments. Everyone takes turns participating in the tasks. Each task shows how many points (stickers) the task is worth. The player with the most stickers wins!

—description from publisher

Name: And Action!
Description:
And Action is a competitive card game about making movies for 2-6 players that takes 45-60 mins to play. You are a producer, racing to create and release movies by which you will earn fame.

In And Action, you collect sets of a script, actor, actress and director to form and release movies. Each character belongs to one of the specific genres: Action, Comedy, Mystery & Romance. You earn fame based on the genre of the script and character cards.

In addition, you can trade with other players, discard to/pick from a talent market and use event cards to reach your goal. Play the advanced version with Award Cards for even more variety. The producer with the highest fame at the end wins!

—description from publisher

Name: Total Control Wrestling
Description:
Total Control Wrestling! The game where you decide how the storylines unfold on TV!

Total Control Wrestling provides players with an entire game system focused on a wrestling promotion with a weekly TV show. Every week, the show builds on the characters, storylines, feuds, and angles of the previous shows. It’s like watching your favorite weekly wrestling show on TV. You never know what will happen, who will show up, or what matches you may see. But one thing is for sure… it will lead to a knock-down, drag-out, feud-settling match down the road!

Create your own wrestlers or use those included in the game to get right into the action! The random creation process allows you to generate a wrestler’s physical stats, never knowing what you may get. Will it be a giant? Or a luchador? Then you decide the wrestler’s style and attributes to fit the prototype. Alternately, players can disregard the random process and assign any stats and attributes as they see fit, making the wrestler of their dreams! Perhaps you want to make replicas of the stars you watch on TV? You can do that, too!

The game system allows players to customize and use whatever elements they want and disregard the rest. Players can track everything built into the game system or use the most basic aspects for matches. Only want to use the Match Charts to determine winners in one-off matches? You can. Want to leave out the XP and Character Progression? You can do that without affecting the rest of the game. If detailing all the Feuds is too much work, leave that out and let the charts tell the stories from one show to the next. For the ultimate experience, get out some paper and pencils and run an entire promotion, keeping track of every stat, win, loss, storyline, angle, and feud from beginning to end.

The Chart Manual guides the general action of the TV show. However, players add the details, develop the personalities, and use their own creativity to enhance the show as it tells the stories from week-to-week. Angles, interviews, and scenarios will build Feuds between rivals until they can settle it once-and-for-all in the ring. New feuds will emerge, old feuds will re-start, wrestlers will turn on each other, and more! The game system provides the methods and means, but it is up to you to decide how and why it happened.

You have Total Control!

Name: Timber Tumble
Description:
A beaver stands on top of a haphazard dam made of wooden cylinders.  Use the wand to knock the wooden logs out from under the beaver, slowly lowering it to the ground.

If you get the beaver to the ground without letting it fall, you win!

—user summary

Name: Connecting Cubes
Description:
Players take turn placing cubes of their color onto a common place area.  Get enough cubes in a row to win.  Both game modes are characterized by there being no board and no limit to how far the common structure might expand as pieces are placed.

In mode A, players can only play flat onto the ground.  They can expand the grid in any of 4 directions, but cannot stack cubes.  Get 5 in a row to win.

In mode B, players can only play into a wall. They can expend it sideways in 2 directions or upwards.  Get 4 in a row to in.

—user summary

Name: Air Flix: Dunkirk – Battle Pack
Description:
Be part of one of the pivotal moments of modern military history with Evacuation Mode. Allied forces are desperately trying to get home, with Spitfire squadrons providing cover overhead but quickly running out of fuel, how many lives can they save?

The Dunkirk battle pack is a standalone game and contains:


    The Dunkirk 3’ x 3’ Neoprene Battle Mat
    Plane Minatures & Acrylic Discs
        3 Supermariine Spitfire
        3 Messerschmitt Bf 109
        2 Boulton Paul Defiant
        2 Heinkel He 111
        2 Barrage Balloons
    
    10 Pilot Cards
    6 Ace Pilot Cards
    1 Fuel Tracker Board
    1 Bombing Map
    10 Bomb Tokens
    2 Squadron Boards
    2 Ranging Sticks
    5 Combat Dice
    Scenario rules for Evacuation Mode


—description from the publisher

Name: Team Yankee: Czechoslovak People's Army – Warsaw Pact Forces in WWIII
Description:
The Czechoslovaks’ recent history with the Soviets had been rocky. 
The liberalisation movement of the Prague Spring was supressed in 1968 by a Warsaw Pact invasion, followed by the reforming government being replaced by a more hard-line communist faction. There is some debate on how this may have impacted the performance of the Czechoslovak armed forces in any future war, but generally by the mid-eighties the army had recovered.
However, there was general unwillingness among the people to support an aggressive war against the west, but they were willing to fight if their country was threatened.

This briefing is a 24-page, full-colour booklet that comes with a complete set of 39 cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Scions of the Flame
Description:
Even amongst the followers of the Ruinous Powers, the Scions of the Flame are zealots. These warriors worship the darkest fires of Aqshy, bringing their blazing wrath to bear on all they deem their enemies.

Sweep all before you with fire and fury – such is the way of the Scions of the Flame! This warband set allows you to field these Aqshian cultists in your battles, containing:


     8 multipart plastic Scions of the Flame miniatures – 1 Blazing Lord, 1 Brazen Champion, 1 Inferno Priest, 1 Immolator, 2 Fireborn, and 2 Initiates, with a variety of weapons options
     A Scions of the Flame abilities card, allowing you to unleash the distinctive and deadly battle tactics of this warband in your games
     11 fighter cards for seeing your rules at a glance, plus divider cards for tracking your tokens


—description from the publisher

Name: Nachod et Skalitz 1866
Description:
End of June 1866. After several months of mounting tensions, war has broken out between Austria and Prussia for preeminent control in Germany. Prussia plans for its troops to cross the Sudetes and penetrate Bohemia by 4 different passages with the objective of confronting the principal Austrian Army in a decisive Napoleonic battle. The outlet of one of these passages was here, near the towns of Nachod and Skalitz. The Prussian V Corps was in position to take control of it and allow the VI Corps to follow it before converging with the other Prussian corps on the centre of the Austrian presence. General Steinmetz is appointed commander of the Prussian 1st Army in 1870 and will have to confront the Austrian troops sent by General Benedek.

As a new unit of the series “Battles in the era of Napoleon III”, Nachod-Skalitz is the first game of a series that will cover the principal clashes of the campaign in Bohemia of 1866, concluding with the battle of Sadowa. Players will have the option of playing the battles one after another in a campaign mode, resulting perhaps in a very different situation by the time they arrive at the decisive battle of 3 July 1866.

Using the series “The Great Battles of Napoleon III” (VaeVictis # 55, # 73 and 138), the system is simple and dynamic with an accent on the engagement of the troops against deadly defensive fire.

—user summary

Scale :

Game turn : one hour
Counters : regiments and battalions
Map : one hex. = 750 m
Complexity : 5/10
Solo playability  : 7/10
Duration : 2 to 4 hours depending on the scenario

(sources : rulebook and description from the Publisher)

The second volume of the campaign of 1866 is Trautenau/Soor (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/372473/trautenau-and-soor-1866)
The third volume of the campaign of 1866 is Münchengrätz/Gitschin (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/418334/munchengratz-gitschin-1866)
Families: Series: Les Grandes Batailles de Napoleon III (Vae Victis)

Name: Aufgepasst!: Ein Verkehrsspiel
Description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events or traffic rules hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Kugelblitz
Description:
65 balls are filled into the funnel-shaped top part of the ball tower and randomly distributed on the five vertical lanes, where they remain stacked.

In the base plate, below these stacks of balls, there are sliders with troughs in which the lowest ball in each case can be pulled out to one or the other player. The aim is to get as many balls of the same color as possible on one's own side in each turn. The winner is the player who has the most balls at the end - regardless of color.

—user summary

Name: Meister Lampe und seine Familie
Description:
In the game, 32 bunny cards, each with 8 bunnies of one player color, are face down. The player whose turn it is rolls the die once and may reveal a card on a 5 or 6. If it is a card of your own color, you may keep it, otherwise you put it back face down. You may then continue to reveal cards until another player rolls a 5 or 6. If you roll a 1, you lose a bunny if you have collected an odd number of cards. The first player to collect 8 bunnies wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Planevo
Description:
The game deals with personality development and the experience of happiness. Players move along a life path, starting at birth, through childhood, adolescence, adulthood, always on the way to happiness. The movement of the game pieces is controlled first by a dice and later by cards. The cards also contain texts with positive and negative experiences, which materialize green happiness stones and / or black ballast stones that you carry in a backpack. At some points in the game, only a certain amount of ballast may be carried. If you have too much, you have to go back and try to get rid of the ballast. In addition, you collect suns and stars on a characteristic board, which in turn must be filled to a certain degree to be allowed to enter the target field. The winner is the one who could collect the most stars.

—user summary

Name: Wortklaubereien
Description:
The players have a bag with tactile plastic letters. A term with words of 3, 4 or 5 letters is revealed. Everyone now searches in their bag - without looking inside - for the matching letters and lays them out. The first player to do so receives the term card. The player who has collected the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Dunlop Tennis-Cup
Description:
A tennis game in 3 difficulty levels for beginners, advanced and professionals. Played with a plastic chip that is flicked over the net with a "racket". The difficulty levels are:
Beginner: The chip must be flicked into the opponent's court. For a mistake the opponent gets a point. With 10 points you win a game, with 2 games you win a match.
Advanced: The game is played according to table tennis rules. In addition, there are fields in the opponent's area on which you can make direct points.
Professionals: It is played according to tennis rules. In addition, there are fields in the opponent's area on which you can make direct points.

—user summary

Name: Weißt du noch...?: Die 50er
Description:
The theme of the game is to put events from the 1950s in the correct chronological order and bring memories to life with narration.

Text and picture cards (movie posters) are shuffled separately and stacked. Each player gets one movie poster card and three text cards and places them in front of them. The cards must now be put in the correct order, for this you may look at the date on the back of the movie poster. Once everyone has laid out an order, the players take turns presenting the events; memories and stories come into play. You get one point for each correct card, in case of doubt the year counts. Whoever has the most points after an agreed number of rounds wins.

—user summary

Name: Letter Drop
Description:
Drop Letters. Make Words. Score Points

Letter Drop is where you'd expect the exact centre of the Venn diagram between Scrabble and Connect Four would be. A fresh fusion of two old games, Letter Drop gives players the vocabulary and resource management of Scrabble, and the visual area control of Connect Four!

Players choose a tile from a small "hand" of tiles of their colour, and place it into the grid to form a high scoring word, or potentially block an opponent. The game ends when the entire grid is full, and all 42 letters have been placed.

The player with the most points wins the round, and the first player to two rounds won, wins. Alternate colours each round, as each colour has a different combination of letters.

—description from publisher

Name: Iron Horse
Description:
A diverse team of outlaws have assembled for the gold heist of the century. Leveraging your unique skills and abilities, send your gang out into the territories to complete side objectives to help your efforts and fight off the Sheriff and Deputy as you try to steal gold from the train. You must act quickly, though! When the train reaches its final destination, your time to steal the gold is over, and you'll fail your mission.

Iron Horse is a fully co-operative, press-your-luck, dice roller featuring six unique characters. These characters all come with their own special abilities and unlockable upgrades.

Name: Berge
Description:
Players are given mountain cards in 3 categories (difficulty of climbing the mountains), which they must work through to the end of the game. You move your figure through Switzerland by rolling the dice and can climb your mountains (dice test). If this succeeds no later than the 3rd time, you get paid a bonus. In addition, a question is asked, the correct answer also earns a bonus. If other players come to your mountain, they have to pay a fee. Further fields trigger events that cost or bring in money. The player who has completed all the mountain cards may run back to the combined start/finish field.  Here there are again bonuses for the first, second and third player. The player who has collected the most money wins.

—user summary

Name: Icosium
Description:
Test your knowledge of Algeria while having fun. 2,000 questions including 70% related to Algeria. 5 categories of questions: history, geography, culture & traditions, sport, gastronomy

Each player places his pawn at the door to Algeria matching his color. Movement around the board is determined by whether a player can answer the question alone, with help, or not at all.  The first player to make it round the board back to his starting point wins the game.

Alone or in a team, the goal of Icosium is to be the first to tour the 48 Wilayas by correctly answering the five categories of questions.

–Description from the publisher

Name: Il Gioco è Tratto
Description:
The game is drawn is a collection of pen&paper games, playable on a small erasable board and pencil format. Each product in the line has a different theme, and includes 10 games.

The game is drawn - strategy - is the first in the collection and includes 10 strategy games:

SQU, by Nestor Romeral Andres
Do and Undo, by Marcello Bertocchi
Tumbleweed, by Mike Zapawa
Spiderlings, by 4brains4games
Password, by Hjalmar Hach
Stampede, by Walter Joris
Yavalath, by LUDI and Cameron Browne
Cartesio, by Silvano Sorrentino
Quartieri, by Dieter Stein
9tka, by Adam Kaluza

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Edge of the Earth: Campaign Expansion
Description:
In the far, uncharted reaches of Antarctica, unspeakable horrors dwell on the edge of shadows.

The Edge of the Earth Campaign Expansion has no player cards in sight. Instead, this expansion contains over 300 scenario cards to support the entirety of the Edge of the Earth campaign, including the materials for a breathtaking new story, branching paths, and more. The best part? All you need is a core set and a copy of this expansion to jump right into this chilling tale—no other materials required!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Edge of the Earth: Investigator Expansion
Description:
In the far, uncharted reaches of Antarctica, unspeakable horrors dwell on the edge of shadows.

In the Edge of the Earth Investigator Expansion, you'll find a treasure trove of player cards the likes of which you've never seen in Arkham history. With five investigators and around 250 cards to expand your deckbuilding options, you won't want to miss this opportunity to strengthen your player card content like never before.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Treasure Chest
Description:
This is a big box, with the outward appearance of a treasure chest, which was the last stretch goal of the Ancient Chronicles Kickstarter campaign. It houses the Wave 1 components, mostly as retail boxes.

The Kickstarter campaign had just one pledge level, Legendary Hero, which was broken down into three parts:

     Ancient Chronicles Core Set and Campaign
     Kickstarter Bonus Set
     Challenge Set


Two bundles of add-ons were offered. The Bronze Bundle consisted of:

     Tristan Hero & Ally
     Metal Crowns
     Doors & Chests miniatures
     Extra Dice set
     Critical Hit bag


Tristan, the Metal Crowns, and the Doors & Chests were not included in any other combo, while a dice set and a critical bag were already part of the rewards.

The Gold Bundle grouped the remaining add-ons:

     Myths of the Arena (Wave 2)
     Chaotic Familiars (5 miniatures, cards, reference sheet)
     Lawful Familiars (5 miniatures, cards, reference sheet)
     Genryu/Shakiko Hero Pack (6 miniatures, hero sheets, enemy sheets, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
     Sigrid/Sigurd Hero Pack (6 miniatures, hero sheets, enemy sheets, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
     Alternate Hero Set (5 miniatures, cards, tokens, reference sheet)
     Ghost Soul Forms (5 miniatures)
     Alternate Ghost Soul Forms (5 miniatures)


All of these, except the Myths of the Arena, are in the Treasure Chest.

The Treasure Chest also includes five more boxes that accommodate most of the remaining Kickstarter rewards:

     Spawn Gates and Gods' Altars (7 miniatures)
     Minions (20 miniatures)
     Nemeses (6 miniatures, venture card, enemy power card, enemy cards, enemy scrolls, tokens, 2 reference sheets)
     Act I Challenge Set (16 miniatures, cards, enemy scrolls, reference sheet)
     Kickstarter Set (5 miniatures, hero sheet, enemy sheets, cards, tokens, reference sheet)


The Treasure Chest inventory is completed by:

     17 Deluxe Hero Sheets (including a blank)
     2 Card Holders
     Critical Hit Bag (choice of color)
     Extra Dice set
     Deluxe Realm Map (Underreign)
     Immortal Souls Act I City (Twin Wyrms) / Darkness Falls Act II City (Moonchild) sheet
     Background Talents and Remembrances reference sheet
     Trait Cards reference sheet
     Site Sheets in the Immortal Souls Saga reference sheet
     20 Heroic Remembrances cards (enemy scroll-sized, 70×120 mm)
     12 Heroic Backgrounds cards
     2 (revised?) Skeld Hero cards
     2 (revised?) Treasure cards
     29 Trait cards
     Set of 6 Tuck Boxes
     Contents sheet (4 pages)


Three additional Add-Ons (included in Sword & Sorcery: Myths of the Arena) were added outside the campaign page:

     Gods of the Arena
     Lords of Endless Pain
     Clash of the Heroes


From the vantage point of the Legendary Hero parts, the distribution is as follows:

Kickstarter Set I

     Core Set:
         Anvil of the Gods Tutorial Quest (storybook)
         1 Warrior/Thief Mercenary miniature
         1 Cleric/Mage Mercenary miniature
         Map Tile Set 1
    
     Kickstarter Set:
         1 Mist Valkyrie Hero miniature 
         1 Mist Valkyrie Hero Ghost Form miniature
         1 Mist's Nemesis
         1 Tristan's Nemesis
         1 Elf Knight on Foot boss miniature [KS Exclusive]
    
     Spawn Gates and Gods' Altars:
         4 Spawn Gates miniatures
         2 Gods' Altars miniatures
         1 Party token miniature
         1 Treasure card
         3 Backer cards
         16 (Revised) Hollywood Armory cards
    
     Nemeses:
         6 Heroes' Nemeses (including Dharma)
         10 Bond cards
    
     Minions:
         10 Venom Minions miniatures
         5 Nest Minions miniatures
    
     Treasure Chest:
         17 Deluxe Hero Sheets (including a blank)
         2 Card Holders
         Critical Hit Bag (choice of color)
         Extra Dice set
         Deluxe Realm Map (Underreign)
         Immortal Souls Act I City (Twin Wyrms) / Darkness Falls Act II City (Moonchild) sheet
         Background Talents and Remembrances reference sheet
         Trait Cards reference sheet
         Site Sheets in the Immortal Souls Saga reference sheet
         20 Heroic Remembrances cards (enemy scroll-sized, 70×120 mm)
         12 Heroic Backgrounds cards
         2 (revised?) Skeld Hero cards
         2 (revised?) Treasure cards
         29 Trait cards
         Set of 6 Tuck Boxes
    
     Digital delivery:
         Campaign Sheet and Card Templates
    
     Northwind Tales (Wave 2):
         Mouth of Doom Quest and Venture
    


Kickstarter Set II

     Minions:
         5 Snow Gremlin Minions miniatures
    
     Treasure Chest:
         Map Tile Sets 2-6
    
     Northwind Tales (Wave 2):
             1 Hawk Familiar miniature
        
         1 Shield Maiden Ally miniature
         1 Werebeast Hero Form miniature
         Werebeast Hero Form cards & hero sheet
         2 Draugr miniatures
         2 Dryads miniatures
         2 Frostguards miniatures
         1 Grimnir miniature
         1 Mountain Troll miniature
         1 Nidhoggr the Undead Wyrm miniature
         2 Valkyries miniatures
         2 Warg Packs miniatures
         1 Werebeast miniature
         2 White Yeren miniatures
         1 Wotan on Sleipnir miniature
         A Winter Fireplace Quest (storybook)
         Dark Heart of the Forest Quest (storybook)
         The Ice Land Quest (storybook)
         Iron Maidens Quest (storybook)
         Ragnarok Quest (storybook)
         Roots of the World Tree Quest (storybook)
         Wotan's Army Quest (storybook)
         1 Deluxe Realm Map sheet
         1 Frostgate Site sheet
         20 Hero Powers cards
         18 Northwind Tales cards
         20 Emporium cards
         25 Treasure cards
    


Challenge Set

     Act I:
         (16 miniatures, cards, enemy scrolls, reference sheet)
    
     Act II (Wave 2):
     (16 miniatures, cards, enemy scrolls, reference sheet)

Name: Election Night in America
Description:
Election Night in America is a 2 to 4 player game where you are a candidate running for the Presidency.

Each player chooses a party and a candidate to run for office. It is up to you to strategize and balance four types of influence, represented by cards: finance, social media, religion, and politics. You will need to navigate the political landscape by rolling dice to avoid scandals and your opponent's schemes. Using influence, you will attempt to win electoral votes for each state.

Will you have the political clout to win the 270 electoral votes to become president?

You will be able to find this game available on KICKSTARTER this fall.

—description from publisher

Name: The Chaco War, 1932-1935
Description:
The Chaco War was fought out by two landlocked countries, Bolivia and Paraguay in South America. On paper, the Bolivians should win handily: they enjoyed a three to one superiority in manpower against the Paraguayans. However, to reach the front the Bolivians had to overcome long lines of communication, impossible terrain and low morale. The Paraguayans, on the other hand, saw the war as a life-or-death struggle. Thanks to their superior morale and leadership, the Paraguayans inflicted a series of defeats to the Bolivians and won most of the Chaco in the post-war peace settlement.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #86, OCT-NOV 2022.

Name: Temple Challenge
Description:
Inspired by the lost pyramid temple cities found deep in the Rain Forest, this game takes on a character of it's own. If you have ever played the game Aggravation, then think how much more fun it would be playing it in 3D!

The Temple Challenge game is approximately 12 inches square by 2 & 1/4 inches tall. Comes with 4 sets of 4 matching marbles, instructions, and a set of dice.

Up to 4 players at a time can play Temple Challenge, each player gets 4 marbles to try and win by making it to the top and out of the Temple.

The end of the game comes when a player gets all of their marbles to their home row.

"—description from the publisher"

Name: You've Lost Your Marbles!
Description:
50 marbles of each color are provided but the game may be played with less marbles as long as both sides start out with an equal amount.

To play this game you start by rolling a dice to see who will go first. Each player will then roll the dice twice for each move to be made, but only moves marbles after the second roll.

The first roll is the determining number.

In the second roll there are three possibilities. If the second number is less than the first roll, you have to give your opponent the amount of your colored marbles you rolled the first time.

If the second roll is higher, then you subtract your first role from the second and take that many of your opponents marbles or take your own colored marbles back along with any of your opponents to complete the number amount.

If you roll the same number both times (same dice combination), you get to take the total of both roles of your opponents colored marbles or a combination of yours and your opponents to match the total number.

If you roll the same total numbers again, then you pass the turn on to your opponent without moving any marbles at all.

The game ends when one side has lost all of their own colored marbles.

"—description from the publisher"

Name: Corona Downs
Description:
First, all the marbles are placed on the board behind the start line. Marbles will be moving to the right or counter clockwise during play. Two dice are rolled to determine the odds for each marble racer from the inside track to the outside track. For instance, if on the roll for marble racer number one a 5 and a 2 are rolled then the odds for that racer is 7 to 1.

The house starts with $1,000,000 (Million Dollars) and each player starts with $100,000 each to place bets on the racers. (This starting amount can be changed).

Each racer is worth $1,000 a race (again this amount can be changed or even randomly set by the roll of the dice) Example, if a player loses on a racer, they lose a thousand bucks! But if they win on a racer they get paid whatever the odds are on that racer: Example, if the racer has odds of 5 to 1 then they win $5,000. A player can place bets on more than one racer at a time.

The dice are rolled for each racer until one racer crosses the finish line. One designated player can roll all the dice for the game or each player can take turns.

The end of the game comes when someone loses all their cash or when a set number of races are run as determined by the players before the start of the game.

With this game you have the option to even make up your own rules, maybe you have some good ideas for how to set up betting for this game.

"—description from the publisher"

Name: Ushuaïa
Description:
Ushuaïa is a family game inviting you to explore the world and its riches and protect the environment, while having fun.

Each explorer moves around the photos on the board and takes on different challenges to earn exploration tokens and complete their mission sheet.
There are 4 types of challenges: our world, exploration, surprising planet and preserving the earth.

The explorer who fills his/her mission card first (6 tokens) is the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Watch on the Oder: January 1945
Description:
Watch on the Oder: January 1945 is a hypothetical two-player game allowing the players to examine the strategic possibilities inherent in the campaign that may have taken place had Hitler decided to send the forces he used historically in the Ardennes to the eastern front. Both sides’ orders of battle are entirely historic within that context. Each of the eight game turns represents four days, and each large hex on the map equals 20 miles. The map runs from the Oder River on the west to the Riga-Pinsk line on the east. Units are German corps and Soviet armies. The turn sequence is I-Go-U-Go, but both players decide if their force will move and fight or fight and move. Playing time is about three hours, and is easily adapted for solitaire play. Complexity is low-medium. The German has to strike hard and fast at the beginning in order to weaken the inevitable Soviet counteroffensive.

World at War #82 February-March 2022

Name: Operation Causeway: Formosa 1944
Description:
Operation Causeway: Formosa 1944 is an operational-level two player wargame covering the planned but never executed Allied invasion of the Allied island of Formosa in World War II. Had the operation been executed, it would have been the largest amphibious invasion of the Pacific Theater of Operations. The Allied objective is to gain control of Formosa with a minimal number of losses. The Japanese objective is to inflict sufficient cost in terms of manpower and delay to make the invasion counterproductive for the Allies.

World at War #83, April-May 2022

Name: BattleCON: Himel Nine
Description:
Himel Nine, the newest member of the BattleCON roster, is an invincible hulk with supercharged weapons. His UA, Invincible Armor, reduces incoming damage down to 1, allowing him to shrug off even the most powerful attacks in the game with impunity.

Invincible Armor can be removed by moving past Himel, and it is also removed whenever Himel moves. This paradox leads to many critical moments where Himel needs to out-speed or out-slow the opponent, and must consider his foe's options carefully.

Himel also has a unique and colorful personality, which comes out on many of his cards.

Name: Word Royale
Description:
Are you smart and quick enough to win at Word Royale?

Grab up to 8 humans and jump into this quick, fun, and challenging game! This game will keep you on your toes and put you on the spot. Quick thinking will give you an advantage while playing Word Royale.

First flip over a category and then you have 5 seconds to say a word that is related to the category that starts with any of your letter cards!

Nothing comes to mind? 
You are eliminated!

Last person standing wins the round!

—description from publisher

Name: ASL Comp: French Algeria – Djebel Fighters 1954-1962
Description:
It is high time that YOUR tactical-level gaming IQ be put to the test in some of the roughest terrain every fought over in this contest of European will and North African stealth ...
 long before the West truly grasped the capabilities of a new kind of foe. 
This brings more never before published CH military art to the fore, as the ALN and post Indochina French paratroopers slug it out...in a never-ending battle that lasted until 1962.

—description from the publisher

Scenarios:

     Jump on the Traitors - Besbessa Mechta, July 3rd 1956
     End of a Convoy - Northwest of Oum-Ali, November 29th 1956
     Operation 423 - Oued-Adb-er-Rahmane, May 21st 1957
     No Time To Talk - Djebel Ouasta, January 11th 1958
     Chased Through the Woods - Beni-Mezzeline Forest, February 14th 1958
     Are These Harkis? - Beni-Mezzeline Forest, February 14th 1958
     Dropped Into Hell - Djebel Mouadjene, south of Souk-Ahras, April 29th 1958
     In the Swirling Mass - Djebel Mouadjene, south of Souk-Ahras, April 29th 1958
     Cross Border Retaliation - Djebel Harraba, Tunisian Border, May 26th 1959
     After the Cease-fire - Near Boualam, April 14th 1962

Name: Winter Queen: Mini-Expansion Set
Description:
Mini-expansions set expand your experience of Winter Queen and consists of 3 fully compatible mini-expansions that you may use with the game.

This set includes:

• Gratitudes mini-expansion:

This mini-expansion increases player interaction and competitiveness of Winter Queen. We recommend playing your first games without it, though. Gratitudes, when you’re ready to use them, will let you experience a new layer of strategy.

At the beginning of the game, you receive 5 Gratitude tokens. Each of them corresponds to one of the crystal colors. When you place a crystal on a Queendom Map board, you flip the Gratitude token of the corresponding color face up, thus activating it. From now on, you may use it. Each token grants you a special one-time ability. When the token is used, it flips face down... until you retrieve it again by placing the crystal of its color on the Map board. Each Gratitude token is a very powerful tool if used wisely. For example, green token allows you to swap any 2 Queen’s Domain tiles on the Map board, and red one can replace up to 3 crystals on the Crystal Holder tiles.

• Royal Jewelry mini-expansion:

This expansion adds a whole new level of strategy. In the base game, crystals from the Spell Books you activate are discarded. Royal Jewelry gives these crystals a second life. After you activate a Spell Book, instead of discarding crystal(s), you move them to your Royal Jewelry card. You may choose to put crystal(s) in the Treasury or add it to your Tiara. At the end of the game the Treasury generates 1 VP for every 2 crystals in it, and The Tiara can generate up to insane 10 VPs!

• Great Wizard solo mini-expansion:

What do wizards do when there are no other wizards to compete with? Well, they perform special quests for their Queen! This solo mini-expansion isâ€¯fully compatible with other mini-expansions and allows you to experience almost the same gameplay even when there are no other wizards around.

When you play solo, replace common Spell Books with 8 special ones and remove all but 20 crystals from the game. Create patterns out of enchanted crystals as usual and do your best to score as many VPs as possible. Compare your result with the chart and measure your success on a scale from a mere Charlatan to a truly Great Wizard!

Name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Litterära klassiker
Description:
BEZZERWIZZER Bricks is a series of small quiz packages in a variety of subjects. The game is a perfect gift for the football fan, fantasy nerd or movie lover.

Have you also cried for Gösta Berling and Don Quixote and laughed with Madicken and d’Artagnan? Have you followed Raskolnikov through St. Petersburg and Heathcliff out into the heath? Here is the quiz for all of us who have Camus, Christie and Kipling on the shelf.

Name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Dark
Description:
A memory and bluffing game featuring monster cards from classic literature (plus some modern ones like "hunk vampire" and "teen wolf") and the neutralizer cards that can destroy them. Each monster has an ability such as triggering the top card of your discard pile. You don't play cards from your hand; you take cards from a 4-card pool and trigger the card as you take it. At the end of the game players discard down to their best 2 cards. Neutralizers then destroy their corresponding monsters, and the player with the best surviving combination of cards wins.

GOAL
End the game with the highest combined point total between your final 2 cards.

SETUP
Shuffle all cards and deal 4 face-up into the center row (the Pool), and one face- down into each player’s personal discard pile. At any time, players may look at (but not rearrange) their discard pile. Choose a random “start player” to begin.

EACH PLAYER’S TURN (proceed clockwise)
Draw a card from the Pool, say its name and number aloud, and trigger/resolve  its primary ability. (If another card gets triggered, reveal it and resolve it.) Fill the Pool back to 4 from the face-down deck.

At the end of your turn, if you exceed your hand limit (3 cards), discard excess cards face-down to your discard pile. When the draw deck is empty, continue taking turns until everyone has had an equal number. Then Resolution begins.

NEUTRALIZER CARDS
These do nothing when drawn/triggered; instead they are used during Resolution. Most Neutralizers negate the points granted by 2 specific Monsters (in any players’ hands). Neutralizers are not Monsters; their points can’t be negated.

RESOLUTION (combine / score your 2 cards)
All players discard down to just 2 cards. In turn order, each player dramatically reveals their highest-number card. Then they reveal their other card. Resolve all Neutralizers. The player with the highest total score wins the game. If there is a tie, the tied player with the highest-value surviving Monster is the winner.

—description from publisher

Name: Conus Wabantus
Description:
The game consists of two game boards, five big and many smaller ceramic cones. 
One board is the actual playing field. The central nine spaces hold small cones at the beginning. The active player rolls the five big cones and places them on the second board. Upright cones go in the center, the other cones are go around it, depending on where their tip pointed after rolling. The player then turns the board into the desired alignment and makes their move. All pieces have to remain connected at least diagonally. A piece moves into the direction of the cone tip, jumping over all other connected pieces in front of it (like in Reinhold Wittig's old game Wabanti, which inspired the name). An upright cone means placing a new cone in the central area, a second upright cone means removing a piece anywhere. 
The winner is the first player who has a piece leave the game board on their side.

Name: Leaping Letters
Description:
The librarian has locked up all the "naughty books" in the library. The books have to make three-letter words that match patterns to collect library cards. The book with the most library cards gets a key card. Five key cards lets the book escape.

OVERVIEW

Using letters on the cards in your hand and the common “community” cards, form three-letter words in a specific pattern. These patterns are found on each letter card.

Play in rounds, collecting library cards and exchanging them for keys. At the start of each round, return all the library cards to a common pile. On each turn, a player can perform one action:

    Use one of their letter cards to form a word -or-
    Exchange one letter card and immediately play it if possible


After forming a word, collect a library card worth the value of the word formed. Count the point value of the word formed and grab a library card of equal value. Most letters are worth 1 point, a few worth 2 points and X and Z worth 3 points.

When one player eliminates all their cards, the round is over. The person with the most library card points will get a key. If there is a tie, all tied players get a key. Once all the keys have been dispensed or one player has collected five keys, the player with the most keys wins.

SOLO GAME PLAY
Deal three community cards. Deal yourself ten letter cards. Attempt to use all of your cards to form words. You are allowed a maximum of three exchanges. Win by playing all cards.

—description from publisher

Name: Manstein's War: Decision in the West 1940
Description:
Manstein's War: Decision in the West 1940 is a two-player wargame of the German offensive in Western Europe in May-June 1940 in which the Wehrmacht seized a stunning victory over Allied forces in the Low Countries and France. The game uses a variant of the Boots system to model command, control, and logistics on an operational scale. Both players can fight a campaign of mobility and decisive battles.

The general structure of the game is that each player uses command markers to activate their forces, which are divided into sub-commands (army groups and similar echelons). Each player has special markers which provide additional operational capabilities. Can you turn the tide of history in that decisive spring of 1940?

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #84, June 2022

—description from publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: They Died With Their Boots On (Decision Games)

Name: Budapest Campaign: October 1944 to February 1945
Description:
Budapest Campaign: October 1944 to February 1945 is a wargame of the Soviet offensive in Hungary in late 1944 and early 1945 which culminated in the conquest of the city of Budapest. Throughout this campaign the Axis launched successive counterattacks which regained ground but, in the end, failed to stem the Soviet tide.

There are two players: Axis and Soviets. Each side is divided into sub-commands. For the Axis, this includes Armee Kommando Nord, Armee Kommando Sud (these are not historical designators but are based on German operational practice by this period), and Hungarian forces. The Soviets have Second and Third Ukrainian Fronts, as well as the Romanian army.

Budapest Campaign ends just prior to the start of Spring Awakening (World at War #73) which covers the final German offensive on the Eastern Front. Both games use a variant of the DG Boots system to model command/control and logistics. Various command markers activate player sub-commands and launch major offensives.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #85 August 2022

—description from publisher

Name: Netherlands East Indies: 1941 to 1942
Description:
Netherlands East Indies: 1941 - 1942 is an operational wargame of the campaign in 1941-42 in which the Japanese seized control of the Dutch colonial empire in the South Pacific. NEI is a combined naval-air-land campaign, in which operational capabilities can be decisive. The game system shows the effects of various operations over the course of a scenario. Players conduct Actions which encompass discrete combat, logistical, intelligence and other operations. A player can conduct one or more Actions per turn. All units in the game use a similar combat system. The system shows the interaction of naval, air and land forces. At stake: the resources of the South Seas and the gateways to the Indian Ocean and Australia.

Originally published in World at War magazine #87 (Dec 2022 - Jan 2023).

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 weeks
Square: 245 miles / 400 kilometers
Units: Regiment/Groups/Fleets

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (176 5/8" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 1 or more
Playing Time: 2-4 hours

Note: Players will need to provide one 6-sided die for game play.

Name: Jump Off: The game for horse lovers
Description:
The Jump Off board represents an equestrian show-jumping arena. The board is a hex grid.

Players set out 18 jumps to make their own course for the horses to jump over. Six player pieces are included in the box, but more players can play by adding their own pieces. The game includes trivia cards with equestrian-related questions. The questions are divided into six difficulty levels for players to decide what they want to study. Four of the levels are designed to help the player prepare for the British Horse Society exams (Stage 1 to stage 4), and the game is associated with the British Horse Society.

The players move and answer questions to go over the jumps. The first player to the end of the course wins. Special cards also affect the players' progression.

—user summary

Name: Noten-Würfel
Description:
The players try to form permissible note rows with 10 dice on which notes instead of numbers are shown in a maximum of 3 rolls. For each die that could not be used, one of the 45 question cards must be answered. Plus points are awarded for valid rows of dice and correctly answered questions, minus points for incorrectly answered questions. The player with the most points wins.

Noten-Würfel can be played in teams or with 2-4 players.

Name: Alert! All Hands On Deck: Fleet Expansion
Description:
Add a new fleet to your game with this expansion for Alert: All Hands on Deck (required for play).

Adds 

    5 new ships.
    An optional Create Fleet Deck rule.
    Special abilities are free now but you remove the active threat card from the game.


Create Fleet Deck
Instead of putting ships by the modifier value, pick any 3 ships and their order in the fleet deck.

—user summary

Name: Stimulus
Description:
Stimulus is the first Italian board game designed for adults.  Spicy, provocative and played as a team.

The goal is to reach the finish line on the board first. To do this, your team will have to draw, mimic and overcome unexpected events that will reveal your most secret sides.

There are two modes:

Classic - risque enough for 95% of the population
Party - only for the most daring, ready to drink one glass too many

When to play Stimulus: college parties, bachelor parties, bachelorette parties, pre-evening and any other occasion when your parents aren't around ...

How to Play Stimulus

Open the game table, take the decks of cards and place them face down on the game table. Players divide into teams of at least 2 people. Each team chooses a pawn and defines the captain for the first round. The most excited team starts by rolling the die and moving their pawn on the board.

The captain draws the card that corresponds to the color of the square you arrived at. He looks at the word on the card, and passes it discreetly to the designers of the other teams. It's time to draw. Once all the designers have seen the card, the countdown 3,2,1 starts, GO!

The other members of each team will have to guess the artwork of their designers. The first team to guess wins the round. The winning team rolls the die and repeats steps 4 - 6.

Includes rules for drinking game version as well.

—user summary

Name: Freibeuter
Description:
Trading game back to the time of sailing ships and the great port cities as a transshipment point for all goods of this earth - but beware of the pirates, you do not want to lose the precious cargo.

Transporting goods from port to port brings more revenue the longer the distance. There are 2 ways to earn ducats, either from your own cargo or from the cargo of your fellow players, which you take from them with the help of the buccaneers. The routes are always determined anew, if a ship has reached a target port, thereby one can equip a ship also again. Each ship must be moved once per turn, the range depends on the wind.

A game turn consists of influencing wind direction, setting buccaneer courses, moving merchant ships, moving buccaneers, passing a marker. The winner is the first to reach the agreed ducat sum e.g. 10,000.

Name: ZAC!
Description:
A fun and stimulating game for the whole family, to practice attention skills, train speed reflexes and stimulate the memory.

In the ZAC family hut, somewhere in the Far West, no one ever stands still!  The animals, and even the plants, change position from one moment to the next. Sometimes they are there and sometimes they are hidden. Don’t be fooled, the landscape and the house are always the same but all around goats, horses, tools, and buckets move! Where did they leave the wheelbarrow? And where did the bison go?

You need to have hawk eyes and cat-like reflexes to be able to spot all the elements every time and beat your opponents: at the end of the game who will be the fastest draw in the West?

The game features landscape cards, scoreboard tokens and 36 cards. Each player must get as many tokens as possible to win the game. But, you only have 30 seconds to look at your landscape card and locate the 12 elements on it!

—description from publisher

Name: Cookie Contest
Description:
The goal of this strategic card game is to make a delicious cookie for as many famous food judges as possible.

The object of the game is to score the highest total number of points.

Players earn points when they make a cookie for a judge.

Players lose points when a judge does not receive a cookie before the end of the game.

—description from publisher

Name: まじかる☆パティスリー (Magical Patisserie)
Description:
Each player is in charge of producing a type of sweet, but they dont know what!
Deduce from what your opponent's have made and try to bluff them into thinking they are in charge of something else.

Players are given a card that they cannot see, that is the type of sweet they want to make more of.
Each round, players may play magic cards for various effects, afterwhich they must make a sweet.
After making five sweets, the round ends. Players score 2 points for sweets of their type, 1 for their opponent's types, and -2 if they make the Maestro's sweets.

Game ends when a certain amount of points have been accumulated, whoever has the most points is the winner.

—user summary

Name: イチからファーム (Ichikara Farm)
Description:
Micro deck building game where you try to build the best farm possible.

Players start as a rancher (a single card).
Each turn you play as many cards as you want (hand limit is 3) and then make a purchase and rinse and repeat.
Game ends when the purchase deck is exhausted.

Players deck out their farm with ranches and flower fields (which produces more gold), or with animals like monkeys and deer that help to steal from your opponents.
Hiring carpenters and hunters will help you to grow your wealth faster or to prevent the opponent's animals from creating mischief in your farm.

Accumulate enough gold to build attractions or a zoo to earn precious victory points!

—user summary

Name: Classic Car
Description:
Classic Car is similar to Monopoly. Here you don't collect roads but cars to earn money with them. The players roll their figures over a circuit, can acquire possession cards and must accept events (losses and profits). Some fields (e.g. the foreclosure, the restoration) intervene more strongly in the possession than one is used to from Monopoly. There are several ways the game ends:

     A player gives up
     A player shows a joker card, hoping to have the most money at the moment.
     An agreed playing time is over


In any case, the richest player wins.

Name: ExeCUTEtion
Description:
ExeCUTEtion is the card game of adorable capital punishment, and is for 2-6 players. Do away with your friends and don’t get deadified!

Maybe take out your friends with the help of a happy little Electrocution, or maybe with an innocuous Drowning? Hanging? What about Burying Them Alive? Drawn and Quartered? Impalement? All these, and more in ExeCUTEtion!

2-6 players have three rounds to attempt to take each other out by playing various adorable execution cards in front of each other. Whoever has the least amount of points after the third round, wins!

—description from publisher

Name: Beethoven
Description:
Players collect tiles from the Lifeometer to compose the best symphony they can. Meanwhile, their movement around the Clock dial translates to the fifty-six years of Beethoven's life. When one player completes their symphony, composing enters the final stages before scoring in the Veneration (of Beethoven's life).

The game has three distinct game levels (Early, Middle and Late Periods) and scoring develops in each game, Players score points for the qualities of their symphony; the most points wins the game.

—description from publisher

Name: Dark Spires
Description:
Dark Spires is a small box 2-player abstract strategy game. A ring of 8 realm cards form the playing area.

Players will summon their spire dice onto these cards and move them around the ring in an attempt to block and banish their opponent's spires while resurrecting their own. If your opponent is unable to either move or summon on their turn, you win!

—description from publisher

Name: War Room: Nano-Expansion 'Take Her Down'
Description:
20 chipboard tokens with 2 new rule systems:

DIVED SUBMARINES

The Dived Submarine side is used to mark Submarines that escaped combat by diving after they are returned to the World Map.  These escaped dived subs can then avoid pinning and immediately move to an adjacent sea region.

CONVOY CASUALTIES

The Convoy Casualty side is used to mark sunk convoy ships on the Morale Board.  Each sunk convoy is worth 6 casualty points.

—user summary

Name: D-Day to Berlin: Six Panzer Armee – Scenario 1: The Battle of the Bulge
Description:
6th Panzer Armee is a two or more player scenario for D-Day to Berlin depicting the northern shoulder of Hitler’s surprise attack Wacht am Rhein. 
This was located in the Ardennes in December,1944, commonly known as the Battle of the Bulge.

In this scenario the area of concentration is roughly from Monschau to just north of St. Vith, from December 16th to the 19th, 1944 when the German attack still had a chance to cross the Meuse.

This scenario includes:

     Customized Map
     Order of Battle for both Allied and German forces
     Special rules for the scenario
     New rules for D-Day to Berlin


—description from the publisher

Name: First Victories: Wellington versus Napoleon
Description:
First game in the The Glory and Empire series.

Glory and Empire is a fresh look at grand tactical command, maneuver and combat during the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Period.  The system is focused on command, maneuver and combat that is fast playing, yet accurate and rich with detail.

The game is 125m per hex. Units are battalions and companies for infantry, regiments and squadrons for cavalry and companies for artillery. Each strength point is 100 men for infantry, 50 men and horses for cavalry or  one section, or 2 guns, for artillery. Counters are 5/8".

The rules consist of a Soldier's, Battalion and Brigade rules set. Players can learn the basics with the Soldier's rules, move to a full fledged simulation with the Battalion Game and pick and choose rules from the Brigade Game to suit their tastes. Or players can jump right into the Brigade Game and understand how grand tactical maneuvering was practiced on the battlefield during the 18th and 19th centuries.

The Soldier's Game gives players new to the era an introduction to foundational concepts of tactics in the horse and musket era. In the Soldier's and Battalion Games there are the usual Line, Column, Square and skirmishers.  The Battalion game has two types of Skirmishers, introduces important concepts for maneuvering forces on the battlefield and has more detailed close combat procedures. The Brigade Game adds close columns, attack columns, closed square, Austrian division masses.  Artillery is simplified for the Soldier's and Battalion Games, but the Battalion Game adds artillery ammunition. The Brigade Game adds bombardment zones, bounce through, howitzer fire and separate ammunition tracking for round shot, shell,  canister and shrapnel. The Brigade Game also gives players more tools to react to enemy moves.

The piece de resistance of the Brigade Game are the command rules. Players choose to form their brigades into Grand Columns or Lines of Battle. To deploy for battle the player must decide which evolution to use to form Line of Battle and shake his men into fighting order.  To cross a bridge or move through a defile in the face of the enemy will take careful planning to avoid being embarrassed by the enemy when the columns emerge on the other side. Keeping the troops in good order is all important if  the day is to be won.

The system will make its debut with Lock 'n Load publishing, featuring Wellington's first victories against Napoleon's forces in the Peninsula,  with the battles of Roliça and Vimeiro. If all goes well we'll follow it up with Fuentes de Oñoro and Salamanca.

Play Glory and Empire and learn the trade of fighting a Napoleonic period battle and earn your marshal's baton.

Facebook Page

Name: Monopoly: Horses and Ponies
Description:
This is a re-implementation of classic Monopoly, where players buy and develop sections of the board as they pass. In this game, the places on the board are horse breeds, and the player can build stalls and stables to develop their purchased sections of the board.

Board comes with special player tokens: Riding boot, Horseshoe, Feed bucket, Wheel barrow, Jockey cap, Horse brush.

Name: Professor Noggin's Horse
Description:
The game is a trivia contest between the players. Players roll the dice to see who will answer first. Then, the next player draws a card and rolls the dice to see which trivia question to ask of several available questions. If the first player correctly answers the question, they get to keep the card for the rest of the game. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

—user summary

Name: Châteauguay
Description:
To win, you must connect at least three board sides with your counters. To place counters on the board, you must win tricks whose cards correspond to tiles on the board, which are randomly distributed before the start of the game.

However, you have a limited number of counters. If you've played all of your counters and haven't created a winning formation with your counters, you lose!

—description from publisher

Name: HorsePLAY
Description:
HorsePLAY involves action, challenges, answering trivia, miming, drawing, and possibly singing. The game involves a set of cards in a box, along with a timer, a die, and pencil and paper.

A player draws a card, and reads the action or question to the player whose turn it is. The kinds of actions each card can be are: Champion (high point-value questions with visual clues), Gallery (questions involving a picture), Crossroad (deciding between two scenarios), Trivia/Busking/Adventure (roll to see if you are asked a trivia question, or must perform an action) and Brain Teaser (answer a riddle).

The actions are worth varying amounts of points. The scorekeeper records the points, and the winner is whoever has the most points when the players decide to end the game.

—user summary

Name: Geek Out! The 00s Edition
Description:
Geek Out! is the game of mind-challenging fun that finds out once and for all which player is the reigning geek authority on your favorite geeky pop culture subjects!

In the game, you will draw cards asking you to list things which fall under a certain category. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!), by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to “out-geek” their friends and family.

Geek Out! the 00’s Edition will have you and your friends geeking out and feeling nostalgic about your favorite decade! Are you ready for this dope new edition? Woot woot!

Name: Our Village
Description:
Use resources to construct buildings to help your village. Each building will help a number of people in your village. The player who helps the most people is the winner!

Each turn players have the option of asking another player for a specific resource card. If the other player has that resource, they must trade it for another card from the active player's hand. If they do not have it, both players draw a card from the resource deck.

They may then construct buildings by playing sets of resource cards matching the next available building on a given pile, or upgrade an existing building (only paying the difference) if they have already built a smaller building of one of the available building cards.

The game ends when one player has built 5 buildings in their village, each other player then has one more turn. Players add up all the people their buildings have helped, the winner is the player who has the highest total.

Name: Narratore
Description:
Once upon a time ... there was a game to invent stories all together in a fun way!   Whoever rearranges a sequence of cards first, tells a story inspired by the images and the structure sheet.   Who has more imagination?

The structure cards are placed in the center of the table in order from 1 to 5: these will provide the players with the guide for the construction of the stories.  The dealer shuffles the inspiration cards and arranges them face down and scattered on the table.

The aim of the game is to conquer a succession of cards from 1 to 5. In turn, starting with the player to the right of the dealer, each draws a card from the table until he has 5 cards each (uncovered in front of him).  If no one has a sequence from 1 to 5, the game continues: each player, in turn, draws a new map and discards one in his possession, placing it face down on the table.  If a player rolls a series of 1 to 5, stop the game and try to tell a story by connecting the 4 images with the final map and using the structure cards as a template (on the back of each there is a short description for each phase of the  story that helps the player to create the tale).  After telling the story, the other players give a score from 1 to 10 to the narrator (the votes add up and form the score of each narrator; the scores can be written on a sheet of paper).  he used blankets on the bench randomly and draws five more.  The game continues in the same way with the player to the right of the last narrator.  Whoever gets to 100 points first (or more or less at the choice of the players) wins.  Make up stories A child or adult can play alone by practicing making up stories.

—user summary

Name: Poeticamente
Description:
Do you want to try your hand at an enigmatic and creative game, for lyricists of all ages?

The winner is whoever is faster to compose a themed phrase or poem, in which the initial letters of words or verses recompose a name. (acrostic game)

The theme papers are mixed and covered in the center of the table, even in several bunches. Keep the name card and the marker close at hand.  Each competitor must get some pieces of paper and a pen.

The youngest writes on the name card, in the column, the letters of a name (the chosen name must be at least 4 and maximum 9 letters and can be a personal name but also a common name of thing, person, animal, etc.).  He then puts the card in the center of the table, showing it to the other players. Then he draws a theme map, places it face up next to the name card and the game begins. The first among the competitors who writes a sentence adhering to the subject of the drawn theme map, consisting of words or verses which, read in order, begin with the letters of the name of the ticket, wins the heat. If the sentence is not relevant to the theme, the second fastest player wins, and so on.  The winner earns the drawn theme map. The game continues in the same way with a new round (the player following the first one in clockwise order will draw).

The winner is the one who wins the most theme maps at the end of one or two laps (at the choice of the competitors). In the event of a tie, a play-off takes place.

—user summary

Name: Proverbiamo
Description:
The most famous folk sayings become a fun and original memory game for everyone.  
Put the proverbs back together and surprise your opponents by combining tiles in a new, comical and hilarious way!

Memo dei proverbi The maps are spread out and covered on the table.  The youngest player begins.  He discovers first a red map and then an orange map.  If he manages to compose a proverb, he wins the couple and always continues in the same way, otherwise he puts the covered maps back on the table, leaving them in the same position.  The game continues counterclockwise.  Warning: if a competitor finds the black map, he puts all the maps he has conquered back in the middle.  The game continues until there are no more maps on the table.  Whoever has the most pairs wins.

Creative memo It is played the same way, but in case you discover two maps that do not form a proverb, you stop for a turn.  However, this penalty can be avoided if the competitor manages to justify, with a brief and reasonable explanation, the "new" proverb that she has formed.  If the motivation is accepted by the other players, the competitor does not stand still for a turn, but passes his hand and puts the covered maps back on the table.  For example, “He who sleeps does not catch.  .. "" a treasure "can be a new proverb because ... or" Between husband and wife do not put ... "" money "can be a new proverb because ...

—user summary

Name: Ipse Dixit
Description:
«Veni, vidi, vici», «One for all, all for one!», «I have a dream!».  
Do you know the most famous aphorisms?  
In this fun and original memory game for everyone, you associate each sentence with its author and discover sayings you've never heard before!

The maps are shuffled and arranged scattered and covered on the table (in an easier way the tiles can be arranged in a 6 x 8 rectangle).  The youngest player first discovers a map with a black back (author) and then a map with a beige back (aphorism).  If he manages to match an author with his aphorism, he earns the maps and continues to play;  otherwise he covers them and the turn passes to the next competitor.  The game ends when there are no more maps on the ground: the winner is the one who has earned the most author-aphorism pairs.

—user summary

Name: Sette Sfide
Description:
A fun collection of strategy games in a practical format, for many one-on-one challenges, wherever you want and with whoever you want.  Are you ready? Choose the game, take the marker and think about the right move!

The pack contains 7 boards on which the boards of the following classic abstract games are shown: GOMOKU - NIM - DOTS & BOXES - SNAKES - MAMMA VS PAPPA - CHINESE WALL.

GOMOKU It is an ancient strategy game also called "five in a row". The players take turns marking a square with their symbol (eg "O" and "X"). The first player to get five of their own symbols aligned, horizontally, vertically or diagonally, wins the game.

NIM It is an ancient game of unknown origins. The players take turns erasing one or more cans from a single row.  They must remove at least one jar and can remove any number of cans from the same row.  The last player able to move wins.

DOTS & BOXES It is a "pencil and paper" game with countless variations. How to play The two players take turns drawing horizontal or vertical lines between two adjacent points.  If a player completes the fourth side of a square, he marks that square with the initial of his name (or a letter of recognition) and must immediately draw another line (as if it were an extra turn).  When all squares have been filled, the player who has captured the most squares is the winner.

SNAKES It is the "pen and paper" version of an old video game.  How to play It is played on a 7 x 7 point matrix.  The first player starts from the green "S" point in the upper left, while the other starts with the red "S" point in the lower right, as shown in the image.  Players take turns growing their snake, extending it one segment at a time by drawing a horizontal or vertical line from the previous point to an adjacent one.  The first player unable to move loses.

MOM VS PAPPA It is a "pen and paper" strategy game: the aim is to recreate the word MOM for one player and the word PAPPA on the grid for the other. At the beginning of the game, the players decide who plays for PAPPA (inserting the letters P and A) and who for MOMMA (inserting the letters Me A).  On his turn, the player inserts one of the two letters of his word in any box, without having to use the same letter every turn.  The player who is the first to spell his word horizontally, vertically or diagonally wins the game.

CHINESE WALL is a simple and fun game.  The aim is to be the last player to create a wall that spans three territories.

—user summary

Name: Saltalettera
Description:
A word game for everyone!
Move on the board by jumping from one tile to another, choose the right letters and write the longest word!   A game of language skill and strategy to train the minds of young and old.

Mix the letter tiles and arrange them in the center of the table forming a 5x5 square.  Each player takes a marker, a word-form board and a joker triangle.  Procedure The youngest player places the black placeholder on a letter-card of his choice.  Each player then chooses a letter (present in the selected tile) and writes it on their word-form board (in one of the circles).  Then the next player moves the placeholder onto another letter-card adjacent to the previous one (the movement can take place by one step).  The process is repeated up to that the players have not completed the six letters on their wordform board.  At this point the players, within 30 seconds, must write a meaningful word using their transcribed letters.  Each player will earn as many points as there are letters in the written word.  The score achieved by each player must be written in the corresponding space on the scorecard.  Jolly Triangle During a round, players can play the joker by placing the triangle of their color on the active letter-tile: in the word formation phase, they will be able to use a letter present in that tile an infinite number of times.  New round The trailing player takes the placeholder and starts a new round in the same way as the previous one.  The game continues and ends when a player reaches 20 points (or more or less at the players' choice).  He will be the winner!

—user summary

Name: Idea!
Description:
